purpose: To provide a comprehensive overview of Black workers in the US private sector and participating companies.
title: The basis of our research perspective
data_points: 125M total workers in the US private sector
15M Black workers in the US private sector (12% representation)
~3k all counties across the United States
24 large companies in the US private sector participated in this research
25k employees provided responses to the Employee Experience Survey
50+ Black employees participated in 90-minute focus groups

left.title: Part 1: US private sector
content: Comprehensive benchmark analysis of Black workers in the US private sector that analyzes:

content.text: Total workers in the US private sector
Black workers in the US private sector (12% representation)
All counties across the United States

content: Bureau of Labor Statistics – Occupational Employment Statistics (OES) and Current Population Survey (CPS), 2019
US Equal Employment Opportunity Commission EEO-1 data, 2018
The US Census Bureau American Community Survey (ACS), 2019

right.title: Part 2: Participating companies
content: Analysis of Black employee representation, advancement, and inclusion

content.text: Large companies in the US private sector participated in this research
Employees provided responses to the Employee Experience Survey which includes McKinsey’s Inclusion Assessment
Black employees participated in 90-minute focus groups
